elements.title: 1902 portrait of her (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Emilie Louise Flöge did not like Gustav Klimt's 1902 portrait of her (pictured)?

elements.title: gender-flipped (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the gender-flipped story of Warriors was partly inspired by the Gamergate harassment campaign?

elements.title: Oskar Ospelt (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Liechtensteiner athlete Oskar Ospelt was a two-time Swiss national champion?

elements.title: New Coimbra Fort (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the New Coimbra Fort was founded by 245 men in 15 canoes, guided by an elderly Indigenous man?

elements.title: George Lutfallah (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that George Lutfallah sought to use his wealth to become king of Lebanon, viewing his presidential candidacy as a stepping stone to that goal?

elements.title: Jenny Price (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Kirkus Reviews called Jenny Price's environmentalist book Stop Saving the Planet! a "fun introduction to a serious topic"?

elements.title: Ivete da Graça Correia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ivete da Graça Correia was once called "the public face of the São Tomé anti-drug campaign"?

elements.title: a house designed by Frank Lloyd Wright (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after a Florida family moved into a house designed by Frank Lloyd Wright, one acquaintance said, "How could you let an atheist design your house"?

elements.title: Caribou Legs (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Caribou Legs once ran more than 7,000 kilometres (4,300 mi) to raise awareness for Missing and Murdered Indigenous Women?

elements.title: Destination of the Month (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Destination of the Month

San Carlos de Bariloche

The Argentine adventure capital offers great opportunities for skiing, sightseeing, water sports, trekking and climbing amidst the amazing mountainous landscapes of Argentine Patagonia.

elements.title: Off the Beaten Path (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Off the Beaten Path

Sekigahara

This quaint mountain town and battlefield, where Tokugawa won control of Japan, gives visitors firsthand insight into feudal Japanese warfare.

elements.title: Featured Travel Topic (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Featured Travel Topic

Driving in China

China isn't one of the countries that foreigners commonly explore by driving themselves. If you'd still like to, the first step would be getting a local driving licence.
